task.summary: Rather than use int, use an enum. This makes things easier to read. I realize it adds a dependency on the type of screen in "engine", but it's worth the change. It'll make things a lot easier to understand for the students who work on this.

First iterator of refactor to core. I want to make core easier to understand and to work with for new developers. I moved the core of Core to a function called run, then changed the switch statement to if/ifelse since we haven't taught switch statements yet. I also refactored the logging statement so the students will have less code to look at. Finally (i think), I moved level retrieval to its own class.

Refactored the Invaders class to keep things simple. The main change involved moving the next level logic into the game screen class. This way students can focus on the if statements in the Invaders.run loop and won't have to worry about much else.

Simplify the way screens are show so the logic is easier to understand and implement. Basically, hide all of the semi-complicated stuff in Main and Screen so we don't have to deal with it in Invaders.run--probably the first function students will start working with.
down works, but working on up button
down works, but working on up button(testing github username)
